text: Winfield Scott Hancock (February 14, 1824 – February 9, 1886) was a United States Army officer and the Democratic nominee for President of the United States in 1880. He served in the Mexican–American War and as a Union general in the American Civil War. He was known for his leadership at the Battle of Gettysburg in 1863. Hancock lost the 1880 elected to Republican James A. Garfield by a small margin. ==References== ==Other websites== * The Democratic Trojan Horse; Harper's Weekly political cartoon about the 1880 presidential election * W.S. Hancock Society * Hancock Memorial at Gettysburg * Hancock Memorial in Washington D.C. * Hancock's report of the Battle of Gettysburg * Hancock Park in New York City Category:1824 births Category:1886 deaths Category:American generals Category:Politicians from Pennsylvania Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Military people from Pennsylvania
title: Winfield Scott Hancock
